msContents.summary: Report of proceedings before defensor civitatis about ownership of some property: Nilos testifies for Herois and Taesis (represented by Theodoros) who took to flight because unable to pay taxes on some land; the land was then cultivated by some peasants who, when the sisters returned, turned it over to them with in addition a parcel that, according to the sisters, did not belong to them; Alexandros is the advocate of the peasants; at the end the defensor confirms that the sisters are liable for taxes on all the land

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
74 lines of writing in 4 cols.; blank space of 10.5 cm. at end of 4th col
Large, elaborate hand slightly bent to the right, with enlargement of some letters; a few marks of punctuation
Extensive quotations of dialogue and vivid descriptions
Provides the only extant text of Constantine' s law "praescriptio longi temporis," in Greek translation

provenance.p: Inv. 181 purchased by Columbia University from Mr. Blanchard through H.I. Bell in 1924; no. 19 in Bell's inventory; inv. 182 purchased in 1924 from Abdullah, no. 2 in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Office of defensor civitatis; Roman law; Constantine' s law "praescriptio longi temporis"
